mainEntity.name: What should I consider when repurposing or replacing a room?

acceptedAnswer.text: Key factors include: (1) **Functionality**—match the room’s purpose to your lifestyle (e.g., home office vs. guest room); (2) **Structural limits**—check load-bearing walls, electrical, and plumbing; (3) **Budget**—repurposing costs 10–50% less than full demolition; (4) **Resale value**—popular upgrades include flex rooms or ADUs (Accessory Dwelling Units).

mainEntity.name: Can I convert a bedroom into a bathroom without major renovations?

acceptedAnswer.text: Only if plumbing lines are nearby. Relocating water supply/drainage requires extensive work (cost: $5,000–$15,000). For simpler solutions, consider half-baths with wall-mounted sinks or wet-room designs.
